intro: Echinospermum cariense, commonly known as the Caribou milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks. Its ecological importance includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
